Node.definition: = pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

Node.gloss: to reign|to be king|to be queen|to become king|to become queen
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= practices that conform to the laws of God
= state in which humans are in a position of authority over a group of people
= location where one can not be readily seen by others; ► and where one considers oneself safe from danger

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= state in which people, animals, or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them
= process by which copious amounts of water flow from the skies, often accompanied by strong winds and having a destructive effect
= a relatively large quantity of liquid flowing with strength
= land in which there is a lack of water or rainfall; ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert like conditions, ≈ associated with thirst and hardship
= state in which an object is large in size

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: hastened; hence: = state in which humans are inclined to act rashly, out of anger or a lack of patience

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= process by which an event happens without delay

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which words are pronounced with precision
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon
= foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself
= member of the nobility; ≈ associated with authority; expected to be generous, reliable, and just
= dishonest and untrustworthy person ≈ of exceedingly low social status

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= person who is wealthy ► and therefore belongs to the upper class of the society; ≈ associated with respectability and moral character
= foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself
= foolish actions that show a lack of respect for God and/or one's fellow human beings

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
literally: to make (plans); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities conceive events in their minds, ◄ described as an craftsperson producing an artifact
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= pattern of actions by which humans act as people that are impure in character, without regard or respect for God

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness
= state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to lack something that they are supposed to have
= dishonest and untrustworthy person ≈ of exceedingly low social status
literally: tool; hence: = a plan made to achieve a certain goal ◄ in the same way as a tool is used to create a certain object
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
literally: plan; hence: = a state of moral and ethical corruption, starting with evil plans and resulting in depraved practices, ≈ regarded as foolishness
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

Node.gloss: to destroy|to ruin|to devastate|to break|to harm
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone brings destruction and suffering upon humans and inanimate objects
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
literally: falsehood; hence: = state in which things that are being communicated are factually untrue

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs
= member of the nobility; ≈ associated with authority; expected to be generous, reliable, and just
= a deed that is morally and ethically correct, as can be expected from a noble person (נָדִיב)
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= a deed that is morally and ethically correct, as can be expected from a noble person (נָדִיב)
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
= state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear, which can easily lead to carelessness and arrogance
literally: daughters of a town, region, nation; hence: = women that are inhabitants of a place, town, region, or nation, ◄ as if they were the female offspring of that place

Node.gloss: to be confident|to be unsuspecting|to be secure
Node.definition: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

Node.gloss: to tremble|to shake|to quake|to be disturbed|to be perturbed|to be excited|to flutter
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions

Node.gloss: to be confident|to be unsuspecting|to be secure
Node.definition: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

Node.gloss: to be finished|to be completed|to come to an end|to be past
Node.definition: = process by which an activity comes to full completion
= pattern of actions by which humans harvest the grapes that have matured and are ready for picking
= act of bringing in crops from the field at the time of harvest
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= state/process by which humans experience a strong fear, usually accompanied by shaking and trembling
= state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear, which can easily lead to carelessness and arrogance

Node.gloss: to tremble|to shake|to quake|to be disturbed|to be perturbed|to be excited|to flutter
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions

Node.gloss: to be confident|to be unsuspecting|to be secure
Node.definition: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH
= action by which a human being takes off one or more pieces of his/her own clothing
= action by which humans remove their clothes

Node.gloss: to gird oneself|to put on (clothes, armor)
Node.definition: = action by which someone ties a belt or piece of cloth around the waist; hence also: to put on clothes or armor
= area located on both sides of spine between false ribs and hip bone; ◄ part of human body; ≈ often used to indicate the entire waist region of the body; euphemism for male genitals
= one of the breasts of a woman or other female mammal

= action by which human perform the mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include wailing (ילל) tearing one's clothes, putting on sackcloth (שַׂק) covering oneself with dust or ashes, fasting (צום) or eating specific food, cutting oneself (גדד) shaving one's head (קרח) covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

= a piece of land outside of inhabited areas, which is the property of individuals, generally used for cultivating food trees, grain, and vegetables; can be bought and sold; property which can be transferred from one person to another
= state in which objects have such a high quality ► that they provoke in others the desire to possess them

= a creeping plant that develops a woody stem when it matures; it grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils (שָׂרִיג) ◄ vitis vinifera; ► it bears clusters (אֶשְׁכֹּל) of grapes (עֲנָב) that are sweet and juicy and can be made into wine (יַיִן) ≈ a symbol of blessing, prosperity, and happiness
= process by which humans, animals, or plants produce much offspring, ► and so grow in number and strength

= the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again
= small shrub with thorns; ≈ associated with things of no value, aggression, and destruction
= small shrub with thorns; ≈ associated with things of no value, aggression, and destruction
= process by which a plant,or part of a plant, comes up from the ground or grows from a stalk

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= building or part of a building that has been fortified to provide additional security; often connected to the palace
= a large group of people

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place
= a fortified hill in a city
exact meaning unsure: = construction from which a relatively large area can be overlooked; ► built in order to provide security and protection to the surrounding area
= path through which a certain entity can be accessed, which can vary from a relatively narrow opening on one side to the entire surrounding space
= a large open place on the side of a rock or mountain, ► used for burying and hiding, or as a temporary dwelling place
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

= wild donkey of a relatively large size but with relatively small ears; it has a fawn color with a whitish chest and belly; ◄ Persian Wild Ass or Onager, Equus hemonius; ≈ associated with both untameable wildness and sexual desire
= open land with enough grass and plants to graze cattle or flocks of sheep and goats
= a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
literally: to pour out (one's) spirit; hence: = causative action by which deities impart their spirit on humans

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= land that is suitable for agriculture ◄ as a result of fertility and sufficient rain
= land that is suitable for agriculture ◄ as a result of fertility and sufficient rain
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals
= to hold the opinion that a particular object, person, or event is to be identified with, considered similar to, or to be equated with another object, person, or event
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= practices that conform to the laws of God

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= land that is suitable for agriculture ◄ as a result of fertility and sufficient rain
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

Node.gloss: to be confident|to be at ease|to be calm
Node.definition: = state in which humans feel confident and calm ◄ either because living under favorable circumstances or because of lack of fear when living under difficult circumstances
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH
= state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear, which can easily lead to carelessness and arrogance
= process by which pellets of frozen rain fall from the sky; ≈ associated with destruction

Node.gloss: to go down|to come down|to fall down|to sink down|to descend
Node.definition: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state of being considered fortunate and blessed by God; ≈ accompanied by an attitude of admiration

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

Node.gloss: to thrust aside (someone's) feet > to send (someone) sprawling
Node.definition: literally: to send away one's feet; hence, possible: = causative action by which humans thrust aside the feet of someone who is standing up ► in order to make that person fall down; ≈ seen as an act of aggression
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet

= domestic animal belonging to the same family as the horse, but smaller and with longer ears; it can have variety of colors from dark brown, through light brown to gray and occasionally white; ◄ |iEquus Asinus africanus;|i* ► used to ride on, carry loads, or do other work; ≈ highly regarded; for male see עַיִר (עַיִר) female see אָתֹון (אָתֹון)
